result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory R Hooyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 3 days Huber for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory R Hooyman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Court orders the following:  FINE:  379.00  to be paid within 90 days, failure to pay will result in 3 days huber.
Sentencing hearing on November 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
